description: Comprehensive MariaDB Performance Monitoring Dashboard with DBRE metrics using mariadb_exporter.

panels.description:
**Goal**: Identify MariaDB version
**Action**: Ensure compatibility and plan upgrades
panels.title: Version

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor database uptime
**Action**: Track restarts and availability
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor peak connection usage
**Action**: Increase max_connections if approaching limit
panels.title: Max Connections

panels.description:
**Goal**: Verify configured buffer pool size
**Action**: Should be 70-80% of available RAM for InnoDB-only workloads
panels.title: InnoDB Buffer Pool Size

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor buffer pool as percentage of total system memory
**Action**: Should be 70-80% of available RAM for dedicated InnoDB servers
panels.title: InnoDB Buffer Pool %

panels.description: SSL/TLS status - verify encryption is properly configured
panels.title: SSL/TLS

panels.description: User statistics tracking status (userstat=1)
panels.title: User Stats

panels.description: Audit log plugin status - compliance monitoring
panels.title: Audit Log

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor connection capacity usage
**Action**: If connections approach max_connections, increase the limit or investigate connection leaks
panels.title: Connection Usage

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor thread usage and connection capacity
**Action**: High thread creation rate may indicate connection churn
panels.title: Threads

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor active query execution threads
**Action**: High running threads may indicate slow queries or high load
panels.title: Running Threads

panels.description: **Goal**: Monitor connection abort patterns\n**Action**: High aborted connects = connection issues; High aborted clients = client disconnects
panels.title: Aborted Connections

panels.description: **Goal**: Monitor connection error types\n**Action**: Max connections errors indicate capacity issues; Check max_connections setting
panels.title: Connection Errors

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor query throughput
**Action**: Queries include replication; Questions are client-only
panels.title: Query Rate (Queries vs Questions)

panels.description:
**Goal**: Identify slow query patterns
**Action**: Optimize queries exceeding long_query_time threshold
panels.title: Slow Queries

panels.description:
**Goal**: Analyze SELECT execution patterns
**Action**: High select_scan or select_full_join indicates missing indexes
panels.title: SELECT Operations

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor sorting activity
**Action**: High values may indicate need for larger sort_buffer_size
panels.title: Sort Operations

panels.description:
**Goal**: Detect multi-pass sorts
**Action**: Increase sort_buffer_size if value is high
panels.title: Sort Merge Passes

panels.description:
**Goal**: Compare index reads vs table scans
**Action**: handler_read_rnd_next should be low; high values = missing indexes

targets.legendFormat: Index Reads vs Table Scans per second

panels.title: Handler Reads (Index vs Table Scan)

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor DML operation rates
**Action**: Track insert/update/delete patterns
panels.title: Handler Write Operations

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor temp table creation rate
**Action**: High rate indicates complex queries or missing indexes
panels.title: Temporary Tables Created

panels.description:
**Goal**: Detect temp tables spilling to disk
**Action**: Increase tmp_table_size and max_heap_table_size
panels.title: Temporary Tables on Disk

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor temp file creation
**Action**: High values indicate insufficient tmpdir space or large sorts
panels.title: Temporary Files

panels.description:
**Goal**: Maintain >95% hit rate
**Action**: Increase table_open_cache if hit rate is low
panels.title: Table Cache Hit Rate

panels.description:
**Goal**: Maintain >99% hit rate
**Action**: Increase thread_cache_size if frequently creating threads
panels.title: Thread Cache Hit Rate

panels.description:
**Goal**: Maintain >99% hit rate for MyISAM
**Action**: Increase key_buffer_size if hit rate is low
panels.title: Key Buffer Hit Rate (MyISAM)

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor buffer pool page distribution
**Action**: Ensure adequate free pages; dirty pages flushed regularly

targets.expr: max_over_time(mariadb_innodb_buffer_pool_pages_data{job="$job", instance=~"$instance"}[$interval]) or mariadb_innodb_buffer_pool_pages_data{job="$job", instance=~"$instance"} or max_over_time(mariadb_innodb_buffer_pool_pages_dirty{job="$job", instance=~"$instance"}[$interval]) or mariadb_innodb_buffer_pool_pages_dirty{job="$job", instance=~"$instance"} or mariadb_innodb_buffer_pool_pages_free{job="$job", instance=~"$instance"}

panels.title: Buffer Pool Pages

panels.description:
**Goal**: Maintain >99% hit rate
**Action**: Increase innodb_buffer_pool_size if hit rate drops
panels.title: Buffer Pool Hit Rate

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor read-ahead efficiency
**Action**: High eviction rate indicates ineffective read-ahead
panels.title: Buffer Pool Read-Ahead

panels.description:
**Goal**: Should be zero or near-zero
**Action**: Non-zero indicates buffer pool is too small or flush is too slow

targets.legendFormat: Wait Free Buffer Pages per second

panels.title: Buffer Pool Wait Free

panels.description:
**Goal**: Understand workload patterns
**Action**: Track read vs write ratios for capacity planning

targets.expr: irate(mariadb_innodb_rows_read{job="$job", instance=~"$instance"}[5m]) or irate(mariadb_innodb_rows_inserted{job="$job", instance=~"$instance"}[5m]) or irate(mariadb_innodb_rows_updated{job="$job", instance=~"$instance"}[5m]) or irate(mariadb_innodb_rows_deleted{job="$job", instance=~"$instance"}[5m])

panels.title: InnoDB Row Operations

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor I/O bandwidth
**Action**: High I/O indicates need for more RAM or faster disks
panels.title: InnoDB Data I/O

panels.description:
**Goal**: Track I/O operation counts
**Action**: Compare with data bytes to understand I/O patterns
panels.title: InnoDB Data Reads/Writes

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor fsync frequency
**Action**: High fsync rate impacts write performance
panels.title: InnoDB Data Fsyncs

panels.description:
**Goal**: Minimize deadlocks (should be near zero)
**Action**: Review transaction logic and add proper indexes
panels.title: InnoDB Deadlocks

panels.description:
**Goal**: Minimize lock timeouts
**Action**: Optimize queries and reduce transaction duration
panels.title: InnoDB Lock Timeouts

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor lock contention
**Action**: High waits indicate transaction conflicts or long-running transactions
panels.title: InnoDB Row Lock Waits

panels.description:
**Goal**: Minimize time spent waiting for locks
**Action**: Optimize transactions to hold locks for shorter periods
panels.title: InnoDB Row Lock Time

panels.description:
**Goal**: Keep history list short (<1000)
**Action**: Long list indicates old MVCC versions; check for long-running transactions
panels.title: InnoDB History List Length

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor redo log write rate
**Action**: Size redo logs appropriately for workload
panels.title: InnoDB Log Written

panels.description:
**Goal**: Minimize log waits (should be zero)
**Action**: Log waits indicate redo log is too small
panels.title: InnoDB Log Waits & Fsyncs

panels.description:
**Goal**: Keep pending operations low
**Action**: High pending ops indicate I/O bottleneck

targets.expr: max_over_time(mariadb_innodb_os_log_pending_writes{job="$job", instance=~"$instance"}[$interval]) or mariadb_innodb_os_log_pending_writes{job="$job", instance=~"$instance"} or max_over_time(mariadb_innodb_os_log_pending_fsyncs{job="$job", instance=~"$instance"}[$interval]) or mariadb_innodb_os_log_pending_fsyncs{job="$job", instance=~"$instance"}

panels.title: InnoDB Log Pending Operations

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor log write efficiency
**Action**: Ratio of actual writes vs write requests
panels.title: InnoDB Log Write Ratio

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor network bandwidth usage
**Action**: Track patterns for capacity planning and detect anomalies
panels.title: Network Traffic

panels.description:
**Goal**: Minimize table lock waits
**Action**: Convert MyISAM tables to InnoDB for row-level locking
panels.title: Table Locks

panels.description:
**Goal**: Display the active TLS version and cipher suite
**Action**: Ensure modern TLS (1.2+) and strong ciphers are in use
panels.title: TLS Version & Cipher

panels.description:
**Goal**: Monitor SSL certificate expiration
**Action**: Renew certificate before expiration. Alert if < 30 days remaining
panels.title: Certificate Expires In

panels.description:
**Goal**: Visualize certificate validity period over time
**Action**: Track certificate rotation and ensure validity window is maintained
panels.title: Certificate Validity Period

panels.description: Query rate per second for each response time bucket. Shows how many queries/sec are completing in each time range (requires query_response_time plugin)
panels.title: Query Response Time Buckets

panels.description: Total number of statements tracked in performance_schema digests
panels.title: Statement Digest Total

panels.description: Total errors and warnings across all statement digests
panels.title: Statement Errors & Warnings

panels.description: Total rows examined across all statement digests. High values indicate inefficient queries or missing indexes.
panels.title: Rows Examined

panels.description: Total rows sent to clients across all statement digests
panels.title: Rows Sent

panels.description: Cumulative latency across all statement digests in seconds
panels.title: Total Statement Latency

panels.description: Top 5 statement digests by total execution time. Use this to identify slow queries.
panels.title: Top Statement Digests by Latency

panels.description: Approximate table sizes in bytes (data + index) for the 20 largest tables
panels.title: Top Tables by Size

panels.description: Approximate row count estimates for tracked tables
panels.title: Table Row Counts

panels.description: Total size of relay logs on replica (bytes)
panels.title: Relay Log Space

panels.description: Number of binary log files on the primary server
panels.title: Primary Binlog Files

panels.description: Current position in the relay log. Tracks replication progress on replica servers.
panels.title: Relay Log Position

panels.description: Current number of metadata locks from performance_schema
panels.title: Metadata Lock Count

panels.description: Total table lock waits from performance_schema
panels.title: Table Lock Waits

panels.description: Count of metadata locks grouped by mode and type (requires metadata_lock_info plugin). **Note**: Panel shows 'No data' when no locks exist - this is normal and indicates healthy operation.
panels.title: Metadata Lock Info Count

panels.description: Total connections per user from information_schema.USER_STATISTICS
panels.title: Connections by User

panels.description: Total bytes sent and received per user
panels.title: Bytes Traffic by User

panels.description: Total rows read and sent per user
panels.title: Rows Read/Sent by User

panels.description: Row modifications per user (delete, insert, update)
panels.title: Row Operations by User

panels.description:
CPU usage of mariadb_exporter process.

**Per-Core %** (Left Y-Axis, solid line):
- Actual CPU usage (matches ps, top, pidstat)
- Can exceed 100% on multi-core systems
- Example: 124% = using 1.24 cores worth of CPU

**Normalized %** (Right Y-Axis, dashed line):
- Per-core average (cpu_percent / cpu_cores)
- Always 0-100% range
- Shows average CPU load per core
- Example: 124% / 24 cores = 5.17% per-core

**Typical values (per-core %):**
- Idle: 1-5%
- Light load: 5-15%
- Moderate: 15-30%
- Heavy: 30-50%

**Note:** First reading after startup will be 0% (sysinfo needs 2 refreshes for accuracy).
panels.title: Exporter Process CPU Usage

panels.description:
Memory usage of the mariadb_exporter process.

**RSS (Resident Set Size):** Actual physical RAM used by the process
- What's counted: Code, stack, heap, shared libraries actively in RAM
- This is the "real" memory usage you care about

**VSZ (Virtual Size):** Total virtual memory allocated
- Includes: RSS + swapped memory + memory-mapped files + shared libraries
- Usually 2-10x larger than RSS (this is normal!)
- Example: RSS=45MB, VSZ=500MB is typical

**GOAL:** Stable RSS over time (no memory leaks)

**ACTIONS IF RSS INCREASING:**
1. Check for memory leaks in exporter
2. Reduce number of collectors or databases monitored
3. Check metric cardinality explosion (see Total Metrics panel)
4. Review connection pool settings

**NOTE:** VSZ growth is usually harmless - focus on RSS trends
panels.title: Exporter Memory Usage

panels.description:
Number of open file descriptors.

GOAL: Stay well below system limit (usually 1024 or ulimit -n)

WARNING: If this approaches the limit, the exporter will fail with 'too many open files'

ACTIONS IF HIGH:
1. Check for file descriptor leaks
2. Increase ulimit if needed
3. Review database connection pooling
panels.title: Open File Descriptors

panels.description:
Collector health timeline showing scrape status over time.

**GREEN** = Scraping successfully
**RED** = Failed scrape

**LEGEND SHOWS:**
- Collector name
- Current status (hover for details)

**WHAT TO LOOK FOR:**
- Red bars = Failed scrapes (check logs immediately)
- Gaps = Collector not running/enabled
- Flapping (red/green/red) = Intermittent issues

**ACTIONS IF RED:**
1. Check mariadb_exporter logs for error details
2. Verify database connectivity and permissions
3. Check required extensions (pg_stat_statements, etc.)
4. Review collector-specific requirements

**TIP:** Pair with 'Collector Scrape Duration' panel on right to see if slow collectors correlate with failures
panels.title: Collector Health Timeline

panels.description:
Time spent collecting metrics from PostgreSQL per collector.

GOAL: < 1 second per collector

Use to identify slow collectors.
panels.title: Collector Scrape Duration

panels.description:
Time elapsed since each collector last successfully scraped.

**GOAL:** < 60 seconds (should match scrape interval)

**GREEN:** Recent scrape (< 60s)
**YELLOW:** Delayed (60-120s)
**RED:** Stale/stuck (> 120s)

**SHOWS:**
- Which collectors are running on schedule
- Which collectors are stuck/stale
- How long since last successful collection

**ACTIONS IF HIGH:**
1. Check if collector is enabled
2. Look for errors in Health Timeline above
3. Check Scrape Duration on right for slow collectors
4. Review mariadb_exporter logs
panels.title: Time Since Last Scrape

panels.description:
Total number of metrics currently exported by mariadb_exporter.

GOAL: Keep cardinality under your monitoring platform limits
- Cortex/Mimir: Often have strict series limits
- Prometheus: High cardinality = high memory usage

ACTIONS IF TOO HIGH:
1. Disable unnecessary collectors
2. Filter databases (use PG_EXPORTER_EXCLUDE_DATABASES)
3. Review metric labels for high cardinality
4. Check for label explosion (many tables/databases)
panels.title: Total Metrics Exported

panels.description:
Time since mariadb_exporter process started.

Shows when the exporter was last restarted.
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: mariadb_exporter version currently running
panels.title: Exporter Version
Exporter Self-Monitoring
panels.description: Monitor mariadb_exporter's own performance and health. Enable with --collector.exporter flag.

title: MariaDB Monitoring Dashboard
